summary: The U.S. Agency for International Development's Bureau for Global Health supports health programs across the world. We found that the Bureau hasn't: documented lessons learned from addressing the COVID-19 pandemic assessed its performance bureau wide addressed negative behaviors, such as bullying, that affect its culture aligned staffing with its mission and priorities since most of its workforce are contractors who can't oversee contracts and grants...
title: USAID: Management Improvements Needed to Better Meet Global Health Mission
